intro: Delissea angustifolia var. hillebrandii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
